text:
‘Stranger Things’ star Shannon Purser comes out as bi, addresses queerbaiting

Shannon Purser, known for her role as Barb on Stranger Things, has come out as bisexual on Twitter.

“I don’t normally do this, but I figure now is as good a time as any to get personal. I’ve only just recently come out as bisexual to my friends and family,” she said in a photo posted to Twitter. “It’s something I am still processing and trying to understand and I don’t like talking about it too much.”

The tweet was seemingly prompted by previous tweets from upset Riverdale fans about the use of queerbaiting in the teen drama in which the actress also stars. LGBT viewers were hopeful that the two female leads, Betty and Veronica, would be an item thanks to a kiss shared early on in the series. But when nothing came to be, some criticized the show's use of girl-on-girl action for views.

@shannonpurser @colesprouse beronica fans are frustrated because they were blatantly, undeniably queerbaited into watching the show — jamie not spears (@jmiemarie) April 18, 2017

One twitter user, by the name of “jamie not spears,” tweeted “beronica fans are frustrated because they were blatantly, undeniably queerbaited into watching the show.”

Purser retweeted the user’s thread, responding, “And I get that, representation is so powerful and important. But we didn't write the show? We have literally no say in what happens.”

And I get that, representation is so powerful and important. But we didn't write the show? We have literally no say in what happens. https://t.co/V4k4m8TgKU — Shannon Purser (@shannonpurser) April 18, 2017

In Purser’s coming out tweet, she mentions her previous comments towards the queerbaiting backlash and apologized for what seems to be a tweet directed towards the fans who strongly shipped the two female characters.

“I’m very very new to the LGBT community,” she wrote in the tweet. “I have never heard the term ‘queerbaiting’ in my life until today. That being said, I have never ever wanted to alienate anyone and my tweet was thoughtless. I wasn't referring to all the beronica shippers, just the ones who had been particularly cruel to me personally."

Although this was the first explicit statement about her sexual orientation, the star hasn’t been shy about the topic of sexuality in the past.

Earlier this month, she took to Twitter to talk about the anxiety she experienced over her sexuality.
